conclusion: To determine the voltage across MN and the direction of the induced current through R.
The magnitude of the induced EMF is given by EMF = B * l * v.
The conductor rod MN and the fixed resistor R form a series circuit with total resistance 2R.
The current in the circuit is I = (B * l * v) / (2R).
The voltage across the conductor rod MN is U = (B * l * v) / 2.
Using the right-hand rule for the direction of the induced current.
The induced current flows from N to M through MN and then through R from b to d.
The magnitude of the voltage U across MN is (B * l * v) / 2 and the direction of the induced current through R is from b to d.
